meaning: a small piece of cloth attached at one edge to a pole and used as a marker or signal in various sports.

a piece of cloth or similar material, typically oblong or square, attachable by one edge to a pole or rope and used as the symbol or emblem of a country or institution or as a decoration during public festivities.
a young bird that has just fledged.
openly disregard (a rule, law, or convention).
instigate or stir up (an undesirable or violent sentiment or course of action).
prevent or obstruct (an anticipated event or action) by taking advance action.
the quality of being economical with money or food; thriftiness.
incapable of producing any useful result; pointless.
deny or contradict (a fact or statement).
excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
provoke or annoy (someone) so as to stimulate an action or reaction.
drive (an animal) with a spiked stick.
a spiked stick used for driving cattle.
a chisel with a concave blade, used in carpentry, sculpture, and surgery.
pompous or extravagant in language, style, or manner, especially in a way that is intended to impress.
(of a person) fond of company; sociable.
devoid of guile; innocent and without deception.
easily persuaded to believe something; credulous.
a lengthy and aggressive speech.
lecture (someone) at length in an aggressive and critical manner.
of the same kind; alike.
exaggerated statements or claims not meant to be taken literally.
criticizing or attacking cherished beliefs or institutions.
example: the flag's up
the American flag
the bird had been ringed as a fledgling
the advertising code is being flouted
they accused him of fomenting political unrest
they will present their resignations to forestall a vote of no confidence
he scorned the finer things in life and valued frugality and simplicity
a futile attempt to keep fans from mounting the stage
the impact of the railways cannot be gainsaid
a garrulous cab driver
he was trying to goad her into a fight
the cowboys goaded their cattle across the meadows
he applied his goad energetically to the cattle's hindquarters
a grandiloquent celebration of Spanish glory
he was a popular and gregarious man
his face, once so open and guileless
an attempt to persuade a gullible public to spend their money
they were subjected to a ten-minute harangue by two border guards
he harangued the public on their ignorance
if all jobs and workers were homogeneous
he vowed revenge with oaths and hyperboles
an iconoclastic filmmaker who has pushed the boundaries with every film he's made
